title: Which are the best Bob Dylan lullabies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not exactly a lullaby, but still very nice.  Bob Dylan - Lay Lady Lay  This is a sweet lullaby for people who are going to die. You can play this at my funeral.  Bob Dylan - Knockin' On Heaven's Door  And here is a lullaby for all baby boomers who were dreaming of better times. It's all over now, baby blue. You can go back to sleep.  Van Morrison - It's all over now (Bob Dylan Cover)

I used to sing “Girl From the North Country” to my children to put them asleep, and it worked great (so much so they would sing it spontaneously years later), is it a lullaby, maybe? “Bob Dylan’s Dream” is also a good one, but a lullaby, perhaps? “Lay Lady Lay” “Simple Twist of Fate” “Make you feel my love” all may qualify as well. And lastly, and I suppose, in my mind, perhaps the best lullaby ever written, is “Forever Young.”
